page.title: 11Delph 2
page.content: There are several{old stone woollen {mills}built on the banks of the river, which provided the original power. Two of these mills still produce{woollen {goods.}We visited one of these, the factory of D.& H. Mallalieu. The mill, built in 1863, makes a dramatic picture with its 8 storeys, large windows and unusual chimney (half stone, half brick). All the{processes of carding, spinning, weaving, finishing and packaging take place on the different floors and the machines, now electric,are of considerable historical interest. They range from locally constructed spinning mules and power looms to modern ring frames and Swiss looms. The{finished goods (scarves, rugs and rolls of tartan cloth) are mainly sold abroad to customers in the U.S.A.
